supportDesc.support: Various paper booklets and loose leaves.

binding.p: The materials are held in a single paper folder ( 236 178 ) labelled F.

The entirety of Acc. 4 c I[1-14] were originally wrapped in a paper cover measuring approximately 380 250 when unfolded. On this paper cover, which is highly fragile and damaged around the edges, is written Access 4 C I. Mapper med A-B, E-P.

The manuscript is currently held in a modern archival paper folder measuring
305 215 .
Acc. 4 c I[1-7] are all held in an archival box measuring 320 230 75

origin.p: Written in the Faroe Islands in the nineteenth century.

provenance.p: The manuscript materials were part of V. U. Hammershaimb's private archive and were originally intended for Det kgl. nordiske Oldskriftselskab. They were given to the Arnamagnæan Collection following Hammershaimb's death in 1909.

listBibl.bibl: Chesnutt and Larsen: The Manuscripts of Faroese Ballads VII 69-70

altIdentifier.idno: Acc. 4 c I[5] Faðir og sonur

msItem.title: Faðir og sonur
CCF 125
msItem.incipit: Eg stóð so nær, eg lýddi hará
msItem.note: The title Faðir og dóttir sonur is written in the upper corner on p. 17.

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in two columns with around 20 lines per column.
The written area is 200 165 .

origin.p: Recorded by V. U. Hammershaimb in 1848 from the informant Poul Jacobsen í Garðshirni, Hvalba, Suðuroy.

altIdentifier.idno: Acc. 4 c I[5] Finnur hin fríði (b)

msItem.title: Finnur hin fríði
CCF 26
msItem.incipit: Aijn er giadlen af up landen
msItem.finalRubric: Ende paa finnur fry skrevet i hast
msItem.colophon:
Gode Ven Schroter
Jeg ved ikke om det kan leses
so got maske Elsebettune
kan noget i den

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in a single column with around 21 lines per page.
The written area is 195 150 .

handNote.p: Written in a single hand in a current script.

origin.p: Written on the Faroe Islands in the first half of the nineteenth century.

provenance.p: According to the colophon, the manuscript was sent by the scribe to J.H. Schrøter at a time when Elsebeth Poulsdatter (Elsebeth í Túni) worked as his housekeeper.

altIdentifier.idno: Acc. 4 c I[5] Finnur hin fríði (c)

respStmt.name: Dánial Jögvanson 49 ár gl. á Oyrini í Skálavík

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in two columns with up to 40 lines per column.
The written area is 200 160 .

origin.p: Recorded by V. U. Hammershaimb around 1848 from the informant Daniel Joensen (Dánjal á Oyri) (aged 49) á Oyrini, Skálavík, Sandoy.

msItem.author: J. H. Schrøter
msItem.title: Draft of a letter to P. E. Müller

note.p: Events mentioned indicate a dating between 1820-1823.
The title Fípan fagra has been added in pencil at the top of p. 47 (f. 24r)

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in a single column with around 32 lines per page.
The written area is 197 165 .

origin.p: Recorded by J. H. Schrøter between 1820-1823 in Suðuroy, Faroe Islands.

note.p: An extra verse (21) is written following the final verse (41).
The name Elisabeth Christiane Schroter is written at the end on p. 59 (f. 30r). Underneath Svend Grundtvig as added the date 1845 in pencil.

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Although the paper is prepared for two columns, only the left column is written, with 24 lines per column.
The written area is 195 83 .

handNote.p: Written in a current script by an unidentified hand. Chesnutt and Larsen VII 81 argue against this being the hand of Elisabeth Schrøter based on a comparison with her copy of Trøllini í Hornalondum in Acc. 4 c[II] 4.

handDesc.handNote: A second hand has added minor corrections.

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in two columns with up to 40 lines per column.
The written area is 195 165 .

handDesc.handNote: Minor corrections added in pencil in another hand.

origin.p: Recorded by V. U. Hammershaimb in 1848 from the informant Daniel Joensen (Dánjal við Gjógvará), Vágur, Suðuroy.

msItem.title: Fípan fagra
CCF 48
msItem.rubric:
Fuglin uj fiørini, han aitur Maas, Silkji blaig er
hajma hans, sum kneptt er hans Haar. Fuglin uj
fiørini

condition.p: The paper is in good condition.

layout.p: Written in a single column with 24 lines per page.
The written area is 205 160 .

handDesc.handNote: Written by Johannes Clemensen (Jóannes í Króki).

origin.p: Clemensen writes in Sandoyarbók that he recorded the ballad from the informant Jens Jensen (Biritu-Janus), Sandur, Sandoy, on 9 June 1822.
